post.summary: Create a file entry in GDS and get temporary credentials for upload
post.description: Create a file entry in GDS. Returns temporary credentials for file upload directly to S3 when the include=objectStoreAccess parameter is used. Volume ID or volume name is required for file creation. If a folder path is provided and does not exist, GDS creates the folder path in the appropriate account automatically.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response ([include=[totalItemCount]).Example: include=totalItemCount

409.description: A conflict was found. Make sure the new File doesn't already exist.

default.description: Unexpected issue. Please try your request again. If problem persists, please contact the system administrator.

get.summary: Get a list of files
get.description: Given a volumeId or volume name, get a list of files accessible by the JWT. The default sort returned is alphabetical, ascending. The default page size is 10 items

parameters.name: volume.id
parameters.description: Optional field that specifies comma-separated volume IDs to include in the list

parameters.name: volume.name
parameters.description: Optional field that specifies comma-separated volume names to include in the list

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Optional field that specifies comma-separated paths to include in the list. Value can use wildcards (e.g. /a/b/c/*) or exact matches (e.g. /a/b/c/d/).

parameters.name: isUploaded
parameters.description: Optional field to filter by Uploaded files

parameters.name: archiveStatus
parameters.description: Optional field that specifies comma-separated Archive Statuses to include in the list

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: Optional field to specify if files should be returned recursively in and under the specified paths, or only directly in the specified paths

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: START_DESC END_DESC

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: START_DESC END_DESC

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: START_DESC END_DESC

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Optional parameter to see shared data in another tenant

default.description: Unexpected issue. Please try your request again. If problem persists, please contact the system administrator.

get.summary: Get details about a file, including a pre-signed URL for download
get.description: Get information and details for the specified file ID, including metadata and a pre-signed URL for file download. The URL can be used as a curl command or directly with S3.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the file to retrieve.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Optional parameter to see shared data in another tenant

parameters.name: metadata.include

parameters.name: metadata.exclude
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify comma separated patterns to exclude metadata by their field names.

default.description: Unexpected issue. Please try your request again. If problem persists, please contact the system administrator.

get.summary: Get a list of subscriptions.
get.description: Get a list of subscriptions accessible by the current JWT tokenâ€™s tenant Id.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: Optional event type for filtering returned subscriptions

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Optional parameter to define the page size returned. Valid inputs range from 1-1000.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
Utilized for navigation after initial listing. Valid values include those of
firstPageToken, nextPageToken, and previousPageToken in the list response.
When there are no more pages, the nextPageToken will be null.

400.description: An invalid or missing input parameter will result in a bad request.

401.description: The acting identity cannot be authenticated and authorized.

403.description: The acting identity is not authorized to access subscriptions.

default.description: Unexpected issue. Please try your request again. If problem persists, please contact the system administrator.

post.summary: Creates a subscription to an event type and defines how those events get delivered.
post.description: Events can be delivered to AWS SQS, AWS SNS, or can be used to launch a WES workflow.

400.description: An invalid or missing input parameter will result in a bad request.

401.description: The acting identity cannot be authenticated and authorized.

403.description: The acting identity is not authorized to subscribe to the given event type or deliver to the given delivery target.

409.description: The given delivery target is not valid or cannot be delivered to.

default.description: Unexpected issue. Please try your request again. If problem persists, please contact the system administrator.

DeliveryTargetAwsSnsTopic.description: Configuration for an AWS SNS delivery topic

topicArn.description: ARN for the AWS SNS topic

DeliveryTargetAwsSqsQueue.description: Configuration for an AWS SQS delivery queue

queueUrl.description: URL for the AWS SQS queue

DeliveryTargetWorkflowRunLaunch.description: Configuration for a delivery via WES workflow run launch

id.description: Id of the workflow to launch

version.description: Version of the workflow to launch, for the given id

DeliveryTarget.description: Configuration for the action to perform for events matching this subscription; only one delivery type may be specified

Subscription.description: Details for an Event Notification Service subscription

type.description: Type of event the subscription matches

actions.description: Types of actions the subscription matches for the event type

filterExpression.description: JSON-structured filter expression for events matching the subscription

matchIdentities.description: ACL Identities for events the subscription matches

acl.description: The list of identities that have access to this subscription

tenantId.description: Tenant id of the subscription owner

createdByUserId.description: User id for the creator of the subscription

timeCreated.description: Timestamp when the subscription was created

deletedByUserId.description: Id of the user who deleted the subscription, if applicable

timeDeleted.description: Timestamp when the subscription was deleted, if applicable

isDeleted.description: Whether or not the subscription has been deleted

Service endpoint for accessing S3.
This is optional for AWS S3, but mandatory for other services like Taiwan Computing Cloud.

JobStatus.description:
This enum was originally created to store the type of job on a folder or file entity. 
The Job entity is now used to track this information for copy operations, with the Illumina.Gds.Api.Models.Enums.JobOperationType 
and Illumina.Gds.Api.Models.Enums.JobProgressStatus used to record the type and progress status of the job.

Key prefix within the bucket for GDS to operate within. Volumes may only be created within this prefix and the given credentials need only authorize
access here. If not set, default is to allow operation on the full bucket. No leading slash.

value.description: A simple string value for the argument. Cannot provide both Value and Json at the same time.

json.description: A JSON value for the argument. Cannot provide both Value and Json at the same time.

options.description:
Comma separated list of options for the argument: Required, Overridable, Writable, Json, Optional, ReadOnly, Final
Some combinations of options are considered errors, like Required/Optional, Overridable/Final, Writable/ReadOnly, etc.

WorkflowConnection.description: Defines a connection that can be used in a workflow definition to perform actions

type.description: Type of the connection: PlatformJwt, ApiBearerToken, AwsCredentials, ApiCustomAuthentication, BsshOAuthV2

host.description: For API based connections, the Host part of the API endpoint

hostValidationRegex.description: Regex that hosts associated with this connection must meet (when host override by each run is allowed)

credentials.description: Credentials associated with the connection. Format depends on type of connection.

options.description: Comma separated list of options associated with the connection: CredentialsRequired, AllowCredentialsOverride, AutoDisableCredentialsAfterUse, AllowHostOverride

autoDisableUrl.description: Relative URL (relative to Host) to call in order to disable the credentials

autoDisableHttpMethod.description: Http method to use to disable the credentials. Must be POST, PUT or DELETE
